msItem.title: Kjalnesinga saga French
msItem.incipit: Helgi bjóka, fils de Ketill flatnefr
msItem.explicit: Et nous terminons ici la Kjalnesingasaga.
msItem.note: Fols. 69r-73r: table of names and placenames, map of Kjalnesinga saga

msItem.title: Jökuls þáttur Búasonar (French)
Jökuls þáttr Búasonar
msItem.incipit: Jokull est honeur de son oeuvre
msItem.explicit: Et ainsi finit on de parler de lui.
msItem.note: Fols. 97r-98r contain: table of names and placenames
Note on fol. 74r reads: Edition de Reykjavik 1902

msItem.title: Hænsa-Þóris saga (French)
msItem.incipit: Il y avait un homme appelé Oddr
msItem.explicit: Et ici finit la Hoensa-Þóris saga.
msItem.note: Fols. 158r-162r contain: table of names and placenames, map of Hoensa- Þóris saga
Note on fol. 99r reads: Edition de Þorleifr Jónsson - Reykjavik - 1892

msItem.title: Hrafnkels saga Freysgoða (French)
msItem.incipit: Ce fut aux jours du roi Haraldr inn hárfagri
msItem.explicit: Et nous finissons ici de parler de Hrafnkell.
msItem.note: Fols. 222r-227r contain: table of names and placenames, maps of Hrafnkels saga and Iceland
Note on fol. 163r reads: Edition de Reykjavik 1893

msItem.title: Friðþjófs saga (French)
msItem.incipit: Cette saga commence on ce que le roi Beli
msItem.explicit: Et ici finit la saga de Friðþjófr enn fraekni.
msItem.note: Fols. 281r-282r contain: table of names and placenames
Note on fol. 228r reads: Edition Ludvig Larsson, Halle 1901. Edition de Reykjavk 1886. Traduction anglaisede E. Magnússon et Morris; traduction francaise de Felix Wagner.

msItem.title: Grænlendinga þáttur (French)
Grænlendinga þáttr
Einars þáttr Sokkasonar
msItem.incipit: Il y avait un homme appelé Sokki
msItem.explicit: Et se termine ici cette saga.
msItem.note: Note on fol. 283r reads: Flateyjarbók b. III p. 445-454. Edition de Christiania 1868.
Fols. 309r-311r contain: Appendix with a list of bishops and churches of Greenland
Fols. 311r-313r contain: table of names and placenames. Fols. 314r-315r: coloured maps, note taken from Konungs skuggsjá

msItem.title: Halldórs þáttur Snorrasonar (French)
Halldórs þáttr Snorrasonar
msItem.incipit: Halldór d'Ísland, fils de Snorri gudi, fait auprés le roi Haraldr Sigurðarson
msItem.explicit: qu'il avait tué un garde de loups du roi Haraldr.
msItem.note: Note on fol. 317r reads: Flateyjarbók (Óláfs saga Tryggvasonar). Tome I, p. 506-511. Edition de Kristiania 1860.
Fol. 331v: map of Trøndelag. Fol. 332r contains: table of persons and placenames in two columns

supportDesc.foliation: Two foliations: one in black ink begins anew with each text; another in red ink foliates entire volume continuously.

additions.p: Fol. 73r: hand-coloured map of the area around Reykjavík, related to Kjalnesinga saga, glued on the leaf. Fol. 162r: hand-coloured map of the area around Borgarfjörður, related to Hoensa-Þóris saga, glued on the leaf. Fol. 226r: hand-coloured map of the area around Fljótsdalr, related to Hrafnkels saga, glued on the leaf. Fol. 227r: hand-coloured map of Iceland, related to Hrafnkels saga, glued on the leaf. Fol. 314r: hand-coloured map of Vestribygð and Austribygð in Greenland, related to Einars þáttr, glued on the leaf. Fol. 315r: hand-coloured map of southern Greenland, related to Einars þáttr, glued on the leaf. Fol. 316r: hand-coloured map of western Greenland, related to Einars þáttr, glued on the leaf. Fol. 331v: hand-coloured map of Trøndelag, related to Halldórs þáttr, glued on the leaf.

binding.p: Bound in contemporary paper with later laminate reinforcement

origin.note: Written shortly after 1904, the publication date of Wagner's translation of Friðþjófs saga
